Title: CrackLib: Buffer overflow
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in CrackLib could lead to the execution of
    arbitrary code.

Background.Text: CrackLib is a library used to enforce strong passwords by comparing user selected passwords to words in chosen word lists.

Description.Text: A stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the FascistGecosUser function of lib/fascist.c.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could set a specially crafted GECOS field value in “/etc/passwd”; possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, a Denial of Service condition, or the escalation of privileges.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All CrackLib users should upgrade to the latest version:
